messages.content: You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the purpose of the Hedera mainnet?
The Hedera mainnet is where applications are run in production, and transaction fees are paid in HBAR. Transactions are submitted, consensus timestamped, and fairly ordered on the mainnet.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How can I pay for transactions on the Hedera mainnet?

Every transaction on the Hedera mainnet requires payment in the form of a transaction fee denominated in tinybars. 100,000,000 tinybars equal 1 HBAR. You can learn more about transaction fees and estimate your application costs on the Hedera website.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Where can I test my application before deploying it on the Hedera mainnet?
You can test your application in a simulated mainnet environment using the Hedera testnet. It enables developers to prototype and test applications.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What happens if the number of transactions submitted to the Hedera Mainnet exceeds the threshold value?
If the number of transactions exceeds the threshold value, you will receive a 'BUSY' response, indicating that transactions are currently throttled.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the throttles for different types of network requests on the Hedera Mainnet?

The throttles for different types of network requests are specified in the Network Throttles table, including cryptocurrency transactions, consensus transactions, token transactions, schedule transactions, file transactions, smart contract transactions, queries, and receipts.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the throttle for Consensus Transactions on the Hedera Mainnet?
The throttle for Consensus Transactions, including TopicCreateTransaction and others, is 10,000 transactions per second (tps) for most types of Consensus Transactions.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How many transactions per second (TPS) are allowed for Token Mint on the Hedera Mainnet?
For Token Mint, 125 transactions per second (TPS) are allowed for fungible mint, and 50 TPS for NFT mint.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the throttle for Smart Contract Transactions on the Hedera Mainnet?
The throttle for Smart Contract Transactions, including ContractExecuteTransaction and ContractCreateTransaction, is 350 transactions per second (TPS) for each type.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Is there a throttle for AccountBalanceQuery on the Hedera Mainnet?
There is no throttle for AccountBalanceQuery, meaning it is unlimited on the Hedera Mainnet.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the throttle for TransferTransaction (including tokens) on the Hedera Mainnet?
The throttle for TransferTransaction, including tokens, is 10,000 transactions per second (TPS) for most types of transfers.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Are there any network request types with unlimited throttles on the Hedera Mainnet?
Yes, Receipts have unlimited throttles, meaning there are no limits on the number of transactions for this type of request on the Hedera Mainnet.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Where can I find more information about transaction fees and estimating application costs on the Hedera Mainnet?
You can find more information about transaction fees and estimate your application costs on the Hedera website.
